text: Baffin Island () is an island in the territory of Nunavut near the Arctic Circle. It is the largest member of the Canadian Arctic Archipelago. It is the largest island in Canada and the fifth largest island in the world, with an area of 507,451 kmÂ² (195,928 sq mi). It has a population of around 13,000 people as of the year 2021. It is named after the British explorer William Baffin. The island was known to the Norse as Helluland. Category:Islands of Canada Category:Nunavut Category:Arctic islands
title: Baffin Island
